intro: Glandularia paraguariensis, commonly known as the Paraguayan glandularia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its glandular leaves and flowers are notable features that contribute to its ecological role in pollination and seed dispersal.
